context.introduction: Discover the essential ingredients and olive oil that form the foundation of Italian cuisine. Learn about herbs, cheeses, and the importance of quality ingredients.

sections.title: Olive Oil: Liquid Gold
sections.content: Extra virgin olive oil is the most important oil in Italian cooking, used for dressing, cooking, and finishing dishes.

sections.title: Essential Herbs
sections.content: Basil, oregano, and parsley are key herbs in Italian cuisine, adding freshness and aroma.

sections.title: Cheese Varieties
sections.content: Parmesan, mozzarella, and ricotta are commonly used cheeses, each bringing unique texture and flavor.

sections.title: Garlic: Sliced Thin
sections.content: Garlic is often sliced thin and gently cooked to release its flavor without burning.

sections.title: Ingredient Tips
listItems: Use high-quality olive oil for best results
Add fresh herbs at the end of cooking
Slice garlic thin for even flavor
Grate cheese fresh for maximum aroma
